history.content:
I don't think APR is completely up to date and should only be used as a sanity check. In order to get an accurate assessment of where you stand with regards to graduation requirements you should book an appointment with an advisor. If a course you know should be counted as an upper div technical such as DS100 is missing, then I think you should be fine and it is an error in the system.

I would also like to know if there is a place to report such omitted courses. For example Stat 150 is not listed in the 15X requirement options for stats majors

I don't think APR is completely up to date and should only be used as a sanity check. But in order to get an accurate assessment of where you stand with regards to graduation requirements you should book an appointment with an advisor. If a course you know should be counted as an upper div technical such as DS100 is missing, then I think you should be fine and it is an error in the system.

I would also like to know if there is a place to report such omitted courses. For example Stat 150 is not listed in the 15X requirement options for stats majors
Student response is correct. We are reporting these bugs and I will bring Stat c100 up again at tomorrow's meeting. I would suggest connecting with the Stats dept about errors in their APR

I am CS Major transfer senior. I just received an email "L&S Advising URGENT: Short degree requirements for Spring 2018 Graduation". I ran the APR on calcentral and I found that CS C100 was not counted as an upper div cs or tech electives.

Is this a bug?(Or a feature)
history.subject: APR Form doesn't count Data/CS 100 as CS upper div
